thread.title: ComScore shares jump on Rentrak buyout - Yahoo Finance
thread.title_full: ComScore shares jump on Rentrak buyout - Yahoo Finance

author: yahoo
title: ComScore shares jump on Rentrak buyout - Yahoo Finance
text:
NEW YORK (AP) -- Shares of ComScore soared more than 8 percent before the opening bell Wednesday on news that it would acquire Rentrak in an all-stock deal to create a larger ratings and media analysis company.
The Reston, Virginia company provides audience analysis for advertising agencies, networks and publishers with a focus on digital entertainment. Rentrak, based in Portland, Oregon, focuses more on television and film. Both companies analyze usage, viewing behavior and demographics. The combined company's key rival would be the better-known ratings and media analysis firm Nielsen.
Rentrak Corp. will merge into a unit of ComScore and each share of Rentrak will be converted into the right to receive 1.15 shares of ComScore. Upon completion of the buyout, ComScore shareholders are expected to own approximately 66.5 percent of the new company and Rentrak shareholders are expected to own about 33.5 percent.
ComScore's current chief executive, Serge Matta, will lead the combined company as CEO. The new company's board will consist of eight directors from ComScore and four from Rentrak.
Shares of ComScore Inc. rose $3.53 to $45.02 in premarket trading while shares of Rentrak jumped $5.61, or 12.9 percent to $49.06.
ComScore Rentrak
